review_title: Nice place but chronically understaffed and underpaid
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Madison, WI
pros:
All of the residents are wonderful.
My supervisors were all very kind and helpful. Most of the coworkers were great as well.
cons:
Extremely overworked. They don't pay enough to keep people there long term, and poor COVID policies plus the pay and people were leaving in droves. Everyone I worked with day to day was great, but there has been an exodus of talented supervisors leaving a lot of gaps in knowledge and people. Even the best coworkers and supervisors can't help you if they are super overworked too. 
Chronic under-staffing means that tasks are going undone for days or weeks. Most days coming into work since spring/summer 2020 has felt like a day long sprint.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Madison, WI
pros: Very fulfilling job working directly with residents and great place to gain experience in many settings. You can work in memory care, independent living, nursing home, transitional care settings, as well as a skilled nursing unit. Can gain PTO pretty quickly. Great coworkers as well.
cons: They highlight tuition reimbursement as a hiring point but only cover $500 per semester which gets you almost 1 credit most places. Will not take any excuses for absences- no emergencies or illness. Although you can gain a lot of PTO, if you request to use it, you are unlikely to be approved even if you request months ahead of time. Very understaffed and lots of turnover so very inconsistent management. Bonuses are only given to staff who accept extra shifts last minute, leaving staff who pick up extra shifts without being begged feeling very underappreciated

pros: Excellent Teamwork and support system
cons: Very Low pay in relation to other LPN jobs

pros: The patients and staff were mostly nice to work with.  The facility is clean and a safe place to work.
cons: The management team could be better.  It is hard to improve on basic needs when there isn't any money to do so.  The attrition rate has to be a concern.  I know there are a number of low paying jobs in food service and housekeeping but seasoned staff leave, that should be a red flag.

pros: Pretty campus. Nice parking lot. Good cafeteria.
cons: Some of the worst management ever experienced. Staff overwhelmed with more and complicated demands and responsibilities. No breaks!  Exhausted staff. Patients don’t get enough attention or care. Many overworked staff making errors and managers not training and coaching for mistakes, but firing many many employees. Bullying of some staff. Favoritism of management. HR/management department inexperienced and immature responses to performance issues. Huge turnover!  Mice in patient rooms.

pros: The people Oakwood serves are wonderful, and the staff do their best to support all the needs. Great locations and facilities.
cons: Lack of focus, direction and communication from the top. Change averse. A lot of young staff with a 'job' and clinical staff burnout that leads to high turn over.
